The people who suffer the actual consequences from the US defaulting on its financial obligations won't actually be any of the people making the decisions, it'll be normal people. Comment: Yeah, folks that hang around Reddit seriously underrate the cultural swing right that's occurred worldwide.   In hindsight, Western leaders really did make a massive mistake in the early to mid 2010's in not confronting Putin harder then (and Biden was apparently one person in Obama's world who felt that way, he's turned out to be correct). Putin's actions in Syria were a major reason for the migration that occurred then, and it received huge backlash in Europe and has been one of the major reasons for the rise of right wing populism even though that issue has settled down for years.   There is a reason why center left parties in Europe have capitulated on immigration and it is because the masses have been talked into it being a bad thing.
Author: 95Daphne
